interfaces

Class GeneralInterfaceMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • interfaces.GeneralInterfaceMethods
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GeneralInterfaceMethods
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class that has methods that can be implemented in multiple classes, such as AccountInterface, BankManagerInterface and TransactionInterface. The reason for this class is to get rid of duplicate code in those classes these methods can be reused in all those classes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        public void createAccount(User user)
        Allows the user to create an account. The user will be able to choose the type of account they want to create.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to create an account

      • selectTypeOfAccount

        public java.lang.String selectTypeOfAccount(boolean transferOut)
        Allows the user to select the type of account they want to access, whether it's a chequing, line of credit, savings, stocks or credit card account. Returns the type of account as a string. This method accepts a transferout boolean as a parameter because if the user wants to transfer out, they are not allowed to transfer out from a credit card account and so this will not be displayed as an option for the users.
        Parameters:
        transferOut - a boolean representing the type of transaction the user viewing this current interface wants to do is transfer out or not
        Returns:
        the type of account

      • returnTypeOfAccount

        private java.lang.String returnTypeOfAccount(java.lang.String selection,
                                             boolean transferOut)
        Helper method for selectTypeOfAccount(). Returns the type of account specified by selectTypeOfAccount() as a string that matches the the type specified in each account class.
        Parameters:
        selection - the selection made in selectTypeOfAccount()
        transferOut - the same boolean transferOut from selectTypeOfAccount()
        Returns:
        the account type as a string

      • printListOfAccounts

        private java.lang.StringBuilder printListOfAccounts(java.util.ArrayList<Account> listOfAccounts,
                                                    boolean summary)
        Prints out all the accounts of a certain type that a user has.
        Parameters:
        listOfAccounts - the list of accounts to be printed
        summary - whether this prints a summary or not, if summary is true, this means that the user would like to view a summary of all their accounts and so will print all details of their accounts such as the last transaction, previous transaction and date created, otherwise it will just print the account number and balance
        Returns:
        a StringBuilder with the account number, balance, last transaction and date created of the accounts in listOfAccounts

      • listOfAccounts

        public java.util.ArrayList<Account> listOfAccounts(User user,
                                                   java.lang.String typeOfAccount)
        Returns an array list of all accounts of a certain type of account that the user has specified. For example, returns all the chequing accounts a user has.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants its list of accounts
        typeOfAccount - the type of account
        Returns:
        array list of all the accounts of a certain type specified by user

      • printChoices

        public void printChoices(User user,
                         boolean summary,
                         java.lang.String typeOfAccount)
        Prints out the the the accounts a user has.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to see their list of accounts
        summary - true if the user wants to see a complete summary of their accounts, otherwise the user will just see the account number and balance
        typeOfAccount - the type of account that the user wants to see

      • selectAccount

        public Account selectAccount(java.lang.String action,
                             java.util.ArrayList<Account> listOfAccounts)
        Returns the account that the user has selected. Allows the user to enter the account number the user wants to perform a transaction on and return that account.
        Parameters:
        action - the type of action the user would like to perform, this can be deposit, withdraw, transfer in, etc.
        listOfAccounts - the list of accounts that the user can select from
        Returns:
        the account the user has selected

      • selectAmount

        public double selectAmount()
        Allows the user to input an amount that they would like to transfer in/out. This method also checks whether the user has input the valid amount. If not, then the method will ask the user to enter again.
        Returns:
        the amount the user has input

      • findUser

        public User findUser(java.lang.String username)
        Returns the user of the given username.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user
        Returns:
        the User with the specified username

      • writeObject

        private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to store the GeneralInterface object.
        Parameters:
        oos - instance of the ObjectOutputStream class to write the Generalinterface object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to restore the general interface's information after the ATM is restarted.
        Parameters:
        ois - instance of the ObjectInputStream class used to deserialize object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object could not be found
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • readObjectNoData

        private void readObjectNoData()
                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
        Used in serialization when class inheritance is not as expected
        Throws:
        java.io.ObjectStreamException - when an attempt to deserialize a back-reference fails
